meanings.definition: A person or thing that closes something.
meanings.sent1: The closers shut the door tightly.
meanings.sent2: She is the one who always closes the store at night.
meanings.sent3: The closers in the storybook made sure all the windows were closed to keep out the cold.
meanings.sent4: The old wooden chest served as a reliable closers of secrets.
meanings.sent5: The closers of the deal were the two partners who signed the contract.

meanings.definition: A relief pitcher who specializes in finishing games.
meanings.sent1: The baseball team's closers came in to pitch the final inning.
meanings.sent2: Fans cheered as the closers struck out the last batter.
meanings.sent3: The closers joked that they were the real MVPs of the game.
meanings.sent4: The closers on the team were known for their ice-cold nerves under pressure.
meanings.sent5: The closers' fastball was so fast, batters could barely see it coming.
